docs.lead_paragraph: Cinven on Monday agreed to buy Britain's third-largest network of private hospitals from the British United Provident Association for 1.44 billion pounds ($2.85 billion).

headline.main: Cinven in $2.85 Billion British Hospital Deal

docs.abstract: Cinven on Monday agreed to buy Britain's third-largest network of private hospitals from the British United Provident Association for 1.44 billion pounds ($2.85 billion). The deal covers 25 sites, totaling 1,544 beds, and reflects the Provident Association's decision to exit health services and focus on insurance. It values the operations at 14.3 times their forecast [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: It is beyond unconscionable that you can have sick children in this country because medical treatment that could relieve their suffering is withheld by people with dollar signs in their eyes.
docs.snippet: It is beyond unconscionable that you can have sick children in this country because medical treatment that could relieve their suffering is withheld by people with dollar signs in their eyes.

docs.lead_paragraph: You won't see these stories on television, but Marian Wright Edelman and Dr. Irwin Redlener could talk to you all day and all night about children whose lives have been lost or ruined because they didn't have health insurance. This is not a situation one associates with a so-called advanced country. That you can have sick children wasting away in the United States, the wealthiest nation on the planet, because medical treatment that could relieve their suffering is withheld by men and women with dollar signs instead of compassion in their eyes is beyond unconscionable.
docs.abstract: Bob Herbert Op-Ed column calls on Congress and Pres Bush to fully fund either Medicaid or S-chip, State Children's Health Insurance Program, to provide health coverage for nine million American children who are uninsured; supports Children's Defense Fund Pres Marian Wright Edelman and Children's Health Fund Pres Dr Irwin Redlener, who are both advocates for insuring children; scores Bush administration budget proposal that calls for just $4.8 billion in new funding for S-chip over next five years (M)
docs.snippet: It is beyond unconscionable that you can have sick children in this country because medical treatment that could relieve their suffering is withheld by people with dollar signs in their eyes.

headline.main: Early Diagnosis of Ovarian Cancer (6 Letters)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Symptoms Found for Early Check on Ovary Cancer'' (front page, June 13):
docs.abstract: Six letters comment on early diagnosis of ovarian cancer (June 13 article); Jennifer Cecere and Kirsten A Hickerson say there is urgent need for reliable early screening tool; Laura Hagen urges scrutiny of link between ovarian cancer and use of pill, hormone replacement and talcum powder; Dr Paul R Packer suggests diagnostic laparoscopy to confirm symptoms of ovarian cancer; Dr Michael Harel says only available and pracitcal screening method for ovarian cancer is endovaginal ultrasound; Linda Rosen says insurance industry should cover all preventive and screening measures; drawing
